development_milestones: 19th Century: Development of Organized Hockey with Limited Regulations on Fighting
Early 20th Century: Introduction of Rule Changes to Penalize Violence (e.g., Major Penalties)
Mid-20th Century: Emergence of the 'Enforcer' Player - Dedicated to Protecting Teammates Through Fighting
Late 20th Century: Public and Media Scrutiny of Hockey Violence Increases
Early 21st Century: Efforts to Reduce Fighting with Rule Changes (e.g., Suspensions, Fines)
Ongoing Debate: Calls for Complete Abolition of Fighting Versus Maintaining a Controlled Level
emerging_trends: Increased Emphasis on Sport Safety and Player Wellbeing
Technological Advancements in Tracking and Preventing Violence
